Name: Right or Racist
Description:
Right or Racist is the party card game that confirms and combats stereotypes based on data, studies, and general information. There are 500 cards included.

Stereotype Cards present the players with a statement asserting a stereotype. Players must determine if the statement is right (true) or racist (false). While Debate Cards are subjective statements that players will vote on to determine if it's right or racist - and unlike America, majority vote wins!

But be careful, too many wrong answers and you run the risk of being labelled:
a) a racist bigot who incorrectly believes in too many stereotypes OR
b) a sissy snowflake that cries racism when it doesn't apply.

Name: Intersection
Description:
Players take turns rolling dice and strategically parking (locking) at least one die or combination of dice to score, but don’t get too comfortable because once you park and score, you can risk that score and go for more! Risk versus reward, a little luck, and strategically choosing ways to overcome will ultimately determine how high you can go.

The goal of the game of Intersection is to accumulate the highest total game score. To score points, players must park dice, fix “Sad faces”, and overcome the “Slow”, all while avoiding the “Stop”.

Set includes: 6 game dice, 1 velvet storage bag, and 1 printed instruction book.

Name: FOURCAST
Description:
A weather-themed, pattern-making card game. Use strategy and manipulation to complete your pattern while foiling your opponents. Finish all four weather types to win.

Players use a combination of "plain" and "action" weather cards to manipulate the weather cards in front of them or other players. If they align all four cards to the same color/type, they win that weather type/color.

On your turn, you can choose one action: draw a new card, take the top card from the discard pile and place it, place a card from your hand, or use an action card (Tornado, Rainbow, Lightning, Wind) to perform a special action.

Name: Vikings of the North
Description:
Times are troubled and the seas are full of enemy ships. Manning your fleet with strength, courage and knowledge. Get your ships ready for battle and head out to sea. Your goal is to conquer your opponent's land. Vikings of the North is a different and strategic board game with tactical and fast duels. With three players, the Asa gods have a finger in the pie, which makes the battles extra exciting and unpredictable. Bjørn Andreas Bull-Hansen has conquered the world with his books. The game is inspired by the books in the Jomsviking series and takes you back to the Viking Age.

Start with the first player, can do the following three steps
in this order each turn:
A. Turn over a dice in his port
B. Build a ship
C. Move a ship

The game is over when one of the players can no longer move, attack or build a ship (less than 3 dice in its port).

During the game, players get points for:
• 1 point for each opponent ship that is sunk
• 1 point for each warrior placed in the opponent's port
• 2 points for each pawn placed in the opponent's port. (The special farmers instead give 5 points if they are placed on their corresponding symbol)

After the end of the game, players also get points for:
• 1 point for each ship moved to the opponent's half of the playing field
• 1 point for each dice left by the opponent in their own port.

The player with the highest score wins!

Name: Det nappar med Mamma Mu och Kråkan
Description:
Mamma Mu and Kråkan have lost their adventure puzzles in the lake. Now all the pieces are lying and bouncing around in a mess. You have already received the first piece. But you need five more pieces from the same puzzle to win the game. Now it's time to fish right puzzle pieces from the lake. Each puzzle has 6 pieces.

The players in turn fish up a piece of the puzzle and place it in front of them. If it´s not fit the player's own puzzle, the player can still save the piece.

The winner is the player who has first placed the whole of his puzzle.

Name: Le Labyrinthe du Minotaure
Description: Be the first to get out of the labyrinth imagined by Daedalus while avoiding the Minotaur. This is a tile-laying strategy game. Roll the die then place your tiles, move or block your opponents. Be careful, if you meet the Minotaur in his lair, you will have to face him in a duel!

Name: Bloodsport Gambler
Description:
Bloodsport Gambler, a game for 1-2 players, focuses on a tense & seedy story of risk, luck, and the efforts that sway fate in your favor. The simple gameplay combines card-driven strategy, risk mitigation, and resource management with the thrill of betting, dice rolling, and pushing your luck.

Thrust into desperation by swelling debts, you must gamble on the foul pit fights of Ghoulmorrah in a last-ditch struggle to pay off a merciless syndicate of moneylenders. With looming payments fast approaching, the only way to beat the odds is to sleuth, scheme, and sabotage. While a sure bet is favorable to warding off debt collectors, the risk of getting caught cheating could rid you of your earnings, your reputation, or worse - your life! Only those who are clever and cunning enough to pay off their debts will survive the vile underbelly of the slithering city.

—description from the designer

Name: Sleeper Cells
Description:
In Sleeper Cells players take turns drawing and playing cards to lead attacks against their opponent. The game ends when a player runs out of life. Outwit your opponent in a tactical duel where playing the strongest cards at the wrong time can be just as deadly for you as for your opponent.

Each turn consists of 3 actions. You may draw cards play, flip cards or attack with cards all with the intent of overwhelming your opponent and destroying them.

—description from the designer

Name: Trogdor!!: The Board Game – Expando Deck: Magicks and ‘Mergencies
Description:
Introducing the all new Majicks & ‘Mergencies Expando Deck for Trogdor!! The Board Game. Extend your cooperative burnination even further with all new cards and gameplay elements that give players more options, more interesting choices, and more chaotic burnination!

Communal Emergency Cards that can be used any time on anyone’s turn to get Trogdor out of some tight jams!
Spell Cards with mini side quests to complete that can bring Peasants back from the Void!
Brand new Action Cards to add more humorous variety to gameplay!

Name: The Con-Carnival mystery board game
Description:
There is a traveling carnival rumored to be a front for con artists & thieves... and one has just arrived in your town. Could it be the infamous “Con-Carnival“? By finding CLUEs and gathering points you must determine whether this carnival is the infamous CON-Carnival or just plain FUN. But you only have until 8:00!

DID YOU KNOW: The Con-Carnival is a fictional carnival that originates from The Spirit Seeds graphic novel series.

Name: Passport To Culture: Travel Edition
Description:
In Passport to Culture players travel around the world map depicted on the game board, with the goal of filling their passport with stamps. Along the way players must attempt to answer questions pertaining to the diverse peoples and countries of the world.

The Travel Edition includes more than 1,000 new and unique questions, as well as a Cultural Intelligence (CQ) scoring key score pad and a reduction in player count.

Contents: Game comes with 203 country/ continent cards (with over 1,000 questions), 5 Passports, 50 magnetic passport stamps, custom Passport To Culture die, 15 answer cards, a score pad and instructions.

Name: Anastyr: Echoes of Abscalon
Description:
The Frozen Mountains - Discover the genesis of Anastyr and Abscalon on an adventure that will lead them to change the fate of Alboraan.

A new region: Majestic snow-capped mountains, deadly cold, and brutal clans with rites of madness.

Face the Ice Witch and her regal white dragon in an epic duel... but an even greater challenge awaits you!

Deal with nature's hostility and chilling weather while keeping you opponents from being overcome by a murderous rage.

Name: Anastyr: The Queen's Vow
Description:
The Necropolis of the Mad Kings - The Companions of the Spear face a new threat that could forever change the face of Alboraan.

A new region: a mysterious necropolis, the tomb of an ancient civilization and the kingdom of the necromancer Abscalon.

Legions of the living dead, wraiths of demented kings, and a fearsome amber hearted bone golem block our Heroes' way.

Halt the dead from rising once more by eliminating the source of their immortality.

Name: Birdie!: Golf Nano Game
Description:
Birdie! Golf Nano Game is a golf simulation game that uses an innovative mechanism of rolling the dice and modifying the results to maximize strategy and minimize the luck.

The objective of the game is to complete the 9 holes making the fewest possible shots.

In each turn you must choose your club well (number of dice), hit with the correct force (preset) and take into account the wind (condition). You should also be careful around the sandbanks and the water (hole hazards)...

The player with the best score at the end of hole 9 will win!

Designed for the 2022 9-Card Nanogame Print and Play Design Contest.

Name: Vandrouki: Америка
Description:
A board is a map of America (North America and South America). The goal of the travellers is to collect as many points as they can for visited countries. And this is not always about countries' quantity.

Each player is a traveller with the unique citizenship. In the beginning of a game a player gets citizenship (Russia, Belarus, Ukraine or Kazakhstan), 100 dollars and three bonus cards.

In a player's turn he can do one of the following actions:

     to visit a new country by bus, by plane, by ship or


by hitchhiking. A player moves his meeple to new country on the board. In order to do it he needs to pay corresponding money (price for bus travel or plane travel) or roll a dice (using luck in hitchhiking).

     to earn money by working in a player's current country.
     to make Visa (USA Visa or Canada Visa). Without Visa it is impossible to visit some countries in the game.
     to make international passport.


Also a player in his turn can play bonus cards.

For visiting new country a player gets a flag of the country and gets corresponding points; then he gets a bonus card.

A game ends when all countries are visited. A player with the most points wins.

Name: The Mandalorian Trivia Quiz
Description: Mandalorian trivia quiz. 100 questions with two levels of difficulty.

Name: Speak Out: Not Famous Movie Quotes
Description:
Get friends together for some sidesplitting fun as players try to say different phrases while wearing a mouthpiece that won't let them shut their mouth. This expansion pack features phrases that sound a lot like famous movie quotes…but just "off" enough to challenge players and generate lots of laughs. Players draw from the deck and read the phrase as best as they can, but it's not so easy to do when the mouthpiece is hindering them from forming words correctly. Players try to say phrases such as "We need to walk about your weepy mess reports". Teammates must correctly guess the phrase in under a minute in order to earn the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game wins. The expansion pack can be added to the original Speak Out game or 1 player can use the mouthpiece and everyone else can guess what he or she is saying. (Timer not included in expansion pack.)

Contents: 144 Pieces of Content on 72 Double Sided Content Cards, 1 Washable Mouth Piece, Instructions.

Name: Farts & Fairies: Suprise Farty Expansion Deck
Description: Attack with fart cards. Seek revenge with surviva cards. Unleash the magic of fairy cards. And use strategy with action cards. At the end of the game the player with the least amount of farts is crowned the 'Survivor of the Fartest.'

Name: 时间互搏：假面骑士 (Chrono Clash System: Kamen Rider)
Description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!

The Chinese version Chrono Clash System has two seriesï¼šKamen Rider and LoveLive.

Name: Sheep 7
Description:
In Sheep 7, players take on the role of shepherds trying to round up their flocks of sheep as quickly as possible.
Your flock of sheep has scattered into small groups! As a good shepherd, you must regroup them! If you want to win, be the first to gather your flock!

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Ancient Chronicles – Northwind Tales
Description: In Sword & Sorcery Northwind Tales, the heroes will journey to a land plagued by cold winds and snow, face a fearsome Viking army led by a conqueror named Wotan, find Yggdrasil, the tree that supports the universe, and face the threat of Níðhöggr, the undead dragon. The Northwind Tales Challenge Set expansion allows players to modify the game difficulty and the overall game experience by combining the S&S Northwind Tales enemies with new variants of all rank-and-file Enemies.

Name: Dinosaurios en el mundo perdido
Description:
Up to four journalists - two men and two women - travel to a remote island in the Pacific Ocean to take pictures of dinosaurs.

At the beginning of the game, every player draws a number of cards featuring a picture and the name of the species they have to photograph, plus some info and a difficulty number.

A dice roll equal or great than this number means the picture was taken.

Players then roll and move across the island following paths trying to reach their dinosaur targets. In their journey they can fall in "roll again" and "lose your turn" squares, and there are "air transport" and "sea transport" too, and a bridge!

The winner is the first player to leave the island with all its photographs done.

Name: Cryptid Cafe: Server Pack
Description:
You can now play as your favorite cryptid in Cryptid Cafe.
You'll get 3 of each cryptid server, in 16 unique designs, for a total of 48 cryptid servers!
All the cryptid servers are 1-color screen printed.

Cryptid Cafe Server pack includes - Snallygaster, Flatwoods Monster, Mothman, Thunderbird, Jersey Devil, Grafton Monster, Chupacabra, Wendigo, Jackalope, Yeti, Ogopogo, Bunyip, Loveland Frogman, Beast of Busco, Loch Ness, and Brown Sasquatch.

Name: Planetenjäger
Description:
"Planetenjäger: Discover the solar system"

Are you ready for one of the most adventurous expeditions
ever undertaken by man?

Then discover our solar system! Travel through the solar
system on an exciting and dangerous hunt for the planets.
Only if you move tactically smart with your rocket over
their orbits, you will reach the goal and get the planet
cards.

But be careful: As a hunter you can become the hunted,
because other players are eagerly lurking as space pirates
for prey - for the fuel of your rocket and your planet
cards! Comets can seal your fate, so keep an eye on them!

With friendly support of ESA and DLR.

Name: BattleTech: Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance
Description: Unleash the Eridani Light Horse Hunter Lance on your enemies! Included is the new Sagittaire, as well as a re-posed Banshee, and new variants of the Cyclops and a jumping Thunderbolt—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: BattleTech: Hansen's Roughriders Battle Lance
Description: Unleash the Hansen’s Roughriders Battle Lance on your enemies! Included is the new Penetrator, as well as a re-posed Atlas, and new variants of the Enforcer and jumping Hatchetman—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: BattleTech: Northwind Highlanders Command Lance
Description: Unleash the Northwind Highlanders Command Lance! Included is the new Gunslinger, re-posed and jumping Highlander, and new variants of the Grasshopper and Warhammer—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: BattleTech: Kell Hounds Striker Lance
Description: Unleash the Kell Hounds Striker Lance! Included is the new Nightsky, a re-posed Wolfhound, and new variants of the Griffin and jumping Crusader—no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: BattleTech: Dominions Divided
Description: Dominions Divided is a BattleTech sourcebook providing full details of the events within the Federated Suns, Draconis Combine, and Rasalhague Dominion from 3151 to mid-3152. Included are a full historical summary of events in those regions of space, personality and unit profiles of key players—many appearing here for the first time–and game information to bring it all to your BattleTech tabletop.

Name: BattleTech: Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance
Description: Unleash the Gray Death Legion Heavy Battle Lance! Included is the new Regent, a re-posed and jumping Shadow Hawk, and new variants of the Gargoyle and Catapult —no assembly required—along with four MechWarrior pilot cards and four Alpha Strike cards. Perfect for BattleTech and Alpha Strike action!

Name: #inconversible: Dawn erasing you
Description:
It's a collaborative reasoning game where two or more players can play.

It is divided into one owner of SNS and other players, but everyone has the same goal.

In the quiet dawn, the main character(owner) who just broke up with his lover is trying to delete an SNS photo album containing memories with him/her.

I deleted it by leaving a hashtag, but I couldn't erase the most precious memory.

Other players follow the adjective hashtag left by the owner of SNS, and flip picture tiles that are the most distant from the feeling the hashtag gives. If the last picture tile after the fifth round was the most precious memory, everyone won. If you overturned the most precious memory during the round, everyone lost immediately.

Leave only one precious memory.

Name: 黒猫ポーカー (Black Cat Poker)
Description: This game is cooperative poker. Everyone puts out one card at a time, and everyone makes one role. We will discuss it well and aim to make a better role. However, please note that there are obstacles there. [Purpose of the white cat] Earn the specified points or find the black cat in the specified number of games. [Purpose of the black cat] Do not meet the specified points. However, be careful not to notice the white cat.

Name: 9ポーカー (9 poker)
Description:
Explore poker with a simple "Hunt Strength" number from 1 to 9, in this one handed poker game for two. The information disclosure dice determine the number of face-down cards that can be turned over. Use the disclosure dice to predict your opponent's hand and consider whether or not to chip it.

Use "critical cards" with various effects to advance your battle to your advantage.

Name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Scarlet Witch
Description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Scarlet Witch Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Scarlet Witch Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Scarlet Witch!

—description from the publisher

Scarlet Witch
Control Chaos Magic at the hands of the Scarlet Witch. What she lacks in card burning and skips she makes up with controlling what cards people play. Use her bast array of Reverse Cards to control the direction of the game. You might want to hold onto some reverses to recover burned cards.

Included in this add-on pack:

     One Uno Ultimate Scarlet Witch Deck
     Character specific Wild Cards
     Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
     2 Chase Foil Cards

Name: Gnomadic Gardeners
Description:
You and your opponent are head gardeners at the community garden, with teams formed of gnomes. You need to complete tasks to raise supplies for the local food bank. Unfortunately for you, your free-spirited sprites frequently switch teams and help your opponent accumulate bliss points instead of you! By maintaining a well-staffed team, complete tasks and accumulate bliss to win the game.

Each round, players place at least 1 gnome card face-down from their hand. Simultaneously reveal gnomes and determine who will resolve their cards first. Use your gnomes to fulfill requirements depicted by the current task cards. Doing so will score bliss and sometimes recruit loyal enchanted animals who will help you in future rounds. Finally, both players pass played gnomes to the opponent for use in the next round, while also keeping their own unplayed gnomes. Win by gaining 77 bliss.

Distinctive mechanics include (1) gaining your opponent's expended cards, (2) a sliding card system to generate fresh tasks that you can slightly foresee, and (3) an automa to support solo play.

Distinctive theming includes (1) garden gnomes, (2) silly illustrations, and (3) an unrepuntant love of puns in the flavor text.

-description from designer

Name: Panzer Tiger
Description:
A simple WWII miniature wargame that simulates battles on the western front.
Suitable for all miniature scales (up to 28mm) and many table sizes (from 2x2ft).
A game lasts from 30 minutes to 1 hour.
Army lists and points values for many units are available on the rulebook.

Name: Gear Wars
Description:
-===**** COMING SOON ****===-

STORY
~~~~~
Set in a distant future. Humans must live and survive by playing in an annual game by racing or battling with cars.

OBJECTIVE
~~~~~~~~~
Plays as 1 of 6 unique character roles and 1 of 6 unique vehicles to win based on the type of game modes selected.

GAMEPLAY
~~~~~~~~
There are 3 Phases in the game:
1) Planning Phase: Players will use this time plan for the other 2 Phases (Movement and Attack) Players will play a Gear Card face-down to plan for the Movement Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Movement Phase. Next, Players will play a Weapon Card face-down to plan for the Attack Phase. They may also play a Power-up face-down to add to the Attack Phase.

2) Movement Phase: Players will take turn resolving their movements based on the Gear Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

3) Attack Phase: Players will take turn resolving their attacks based on the Weapon Cards they have selected in the Planning Phase and play any additional Power-ups added.

After completing all 3 Phases, this is considered a round. The phases are then repeated until a winner is determined.

WINNING THE GAME
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Winning the game is based on the game mode players have selected. For example, If it's a Race Mode, they have to be the first to the Finish Line. If it's a Deathmatch Mode, they have to reach a certain amount of points to win.

GAME MODES
~~~~~~~~~~
1) Competitive Race Mode
2) Classic Race Mode
3) Team Race Mode
4) Capture the Flag Mode
5) Deathmatch Mode
6) Team Deathmatch Mode 
7) Elimination Mode
8) Assault Mode

GAME STATS:
~~~~~~~~~~~
Ages 8+
30-45 Minutes
2-6 Players

GAME TYPE:
~~~~~~~~~~
Asymmetrical
Competitive
Cooperative
Family
Party
Sci-Fi

MECHANISMS
~~~~~~~~~~
Action Queue
Bluffing
Deception
Deduction
Grid Movement
Hand Management
Memory
Modular Board
Player Elimination (mode specific)
Programmed Movement
Racing  (mode specific)
Simultaneous Action Selection
Take That
Team-Based (mode specific)

-description from publisher

Name: Simpatico!
Description:
Simpatico! is a social word game in which players try to intuit how their friends transformed one word into another… and another… and another. Each round, the Associator starts with a prompt word and uses instructions on Association Cards to transform it three times. The rest of the players try to guess the two hidden steps between the prompt word and the result. The player who is most Simpatico will come out on top. WILL IT BE YOU?!?!

—description from the publisher

Name: The EVA Engine
Description:
Due to a malfunction in your spaceship engine, you need to make an emergency landing on an asteroid. However, upon landing, your navigation system alerts you to lethal levels of radiation from the asteroid's soil. Your spaceship's shields are not strong enough to protect you for long: you must leave the asteroid before the radiation poisoning overwhelms you. The main frame calculates that you just need 51% of your «EVA Engine» power to take off from the asteroid and save yourself. 
In order to achieve that, you will have to install 4 engine components in the correct order. If you succeed, you will be able to leave the asteroid and win the game. Unfortunately, the components are damaged. Before reassembling the engine, you will need to fix the pieces and put them back in the right order before it's too late!
And despite the nonnrequired opinions of those who judge a game before it is even released, this game uses "time track" mechanics.

Name: Half-Pint Heroes: Bottoms Up! – Promo Cards
Description:
The set contains 5 cards of value 0 which can simply added to the game. The cards added the following rule to the game: whenever a player wins a trick which contains a card with value 0, the whole trick is worth 0 points.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Das Paket enthält 5 Nullerkarten, die ihr einfach ins Spiel einmischen könnt. Die Karten ergänzen dann die Regeln, um eine Sonderregel: Bekommt ein Spieler einen Stich, der eine Nullerkarte enthält, so bringt ihm dieser Stich keine Punkte.

—description from the publisher

Name: Camel Up: Off Season – Show Off!
Description: More Camel-tastic stuff! This mini-expansion add more contents to the base game and ... wait for it ... GEM cards and tiles!!! In the Show Off! mini-extension you will find a new camel, new types of goods, new treasure cards, new tiles, and of course the rulebook.

Name: Who Did What?!
Description:
A situation comedy, question-and-answer card game featuring the players. . .and the players write the punch lines!

Each player's name, plus names of other people known in common to the players, are written on Who cards which are used throughout the game. To play a round, a player judge draws a Who card and a Did card and reads aloud the scenario on the Did card incorporating the name on the Who card. The other players write a response to the created Did card scenario on a What card (dry erase), and submit the response to the round judge. The round judge reads aloud the Did card with each What response and picks a favorite. The player who wrote the favorite response wins the round and a point. The judge role rotates among the players with each Did card.

The player with the most points (4-6 points, depending on the number of players) wins the game.

—description from the publisher

Name: Boratimê
Description:
Boratimê is a Brazilian tongue-in-cheek strategy card game about two soccer crowds competing to push their team to victory by using ridiculous and epic tactics.

Each player takes control of one crowd with unique abilities and must react to key moments of the match. The crowd who reacts best pushes their team forward. At the end of the match, the crowd that inspired the most goals is victorious.

—description from the designer

Name: Good Night Goodbye
Description:
Good Night Goodbye is a 3-5 player bluffing game.
Players play one of three cards to score points.

To win:
The first player to score 10 points is the winner.

How to Play:
Each player gets three types of cards: night, wind, and sea.ã€€The players elect a leader from among their players.

First the leader places a card face down. The player then declares to the other players which of the three types of cards he or she has played. At this time, you may make a false declaration.

Next, all players except the leader declare which cards they will place in turn. Then they each place a card face down. At this time, it does not have to be served as declared.

Finally, the cards placed by everyone are turned face up and the score is calculated according to their combination.

—description from the designer

Name: Quest for Home: 30,000 BC
Description:
Quest for Home: 30,000 BC is a single-player, narrative card game about a clan of Neanderthals searching for a new cave to live in. Your eight-person clan will trek through hazardous terrain, encountering events along the way, while foraging for food, crafting, and entertaining each other to keep spirits up. No two journeys are ever the same.

You begin the journey with a clan of eight people - a mix of adults, youth, elders and toddlers who each contribute dice to the clan's dice pool. Each turn, you decide how far to journey. You can camp in place to rest and remove weariness, or move more quickly through a landscape of forest, meadows, rivers and other types of terrain. Be careful of moving too quickly, however, or members of your clan will become weary.

Each time you draw a Terrain card, you also draw an Event card. Depending on the cards, your clan might have to deal with anything from a sudden blizzard to an encounter with stragglers from another clan.,On each day of your journey, you choose whether to craft clothing and shelter to keep out the cold, to entertain the clan to keep morale up, or to forage for food and medicinal plants. You can only perform two of these activities, so choose wisely - whichever activity you don't choose will cause members of your clan to become hungry, sad or cold. At the end of the day, you check to see if any of your clan become sick - or if they die from illness.

When your clan finally reaches the cave, the game is scored based on how many of your clan survived, and whether they are sick, injured, or suffering from a condition.

-description from publisher

Name: Monslaught in Halloween
Description:
This game is the new deck building game. The player can select and take the new cards in the hand from the discarded pile at the end of the turn. No random.

The players collects the monsters from the field.
Their monsters are added to the deck.
The Boss round is happened every three rounds.

Each cards has the points. After 12th round, the winner is the player with the most points.

Name: Crime Files Adventskalender: Die Northpole Gang
Description:
Solve a Christmas mystery using real clues and evidence in this realistic mystery game - you have 24 days to catch the culprit! Open a sealed envelope every day, solve the hidden messages and unmask the right suspect. The ingenious Advent calendar is suitable for crime fans between 1 and 4 players.

—description from the publisher
Families: Misc: Advent / Christmas / Jule calendar game

Name: Zoknifogócska Szofival
Description:
Sophie doesn't want to wear socks. Mom worries she will catch a cold and tries to put socks on her doughter. Though she starts sneezing, Sophie runs.

Will mom catch her or will Sophie stay barefeet?

Playing as Sophie you try to blow over standing cards just like you would blow candles. Lesser the tries the more you can move. Mother can follow by remembering the color of the blown over sock cards.

Based on a story from the Szofi book series by Bálint Harcos.

Name: Építs velem, Boribon!
Description:
Boribon would like to create a nice house, a car and maybe a boat for his blue toy bear from the colorful building blocks. Help him: roll the dice, carefully place them on top of each other, collect building blocks as a reward. The player who first collects seven building blocs wins.

Based on the Boribon book series by Veronika Marék.

Name: Crazy Hedgehog
Description: In turn, each player must spin the roulette wheel and draw the color and amount of spines to pull from the hedgehog. Hintï¼šThe player should choose the spines on the center and take it very carefully so as not make the hedgehog dropped. If the player take the spine out and does not make the hedgehog dropped, the it would pass the turn to next player. If the hedgehog dropped, the player will finish the turn of the game. The other players set up the game again and continue with another turn. Continue in this way until only 1 player is left. He/She will be the final winner of the game.

Name: Co-opoly: a "conversion kit" for Monopoly
Description:
A conversion kit that turns the classic game of Monopoly into a co-operative game of tearing down luxury condos and building tiny homes for the people. Co-opoly was nominated for an award for "Best Adaptation" by Indiecade 2019.

—description from the designer

Name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Doctor Strange
Description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Dr. Strange Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Dr. Strange Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Dr. Strange!

—description from the publisher

Doctor Strange
Being the master of the Mystic Arts lets Doctor Strange control the playing field. Try to change the active color as much as you can to maximize his character power. Use his Wild Cards for both supporting his character power and stopping players from playing certain cards.

Included in this add-on pack:

     One Uno Ultimate Doctor Strange Deck
     Character specific Wild Cards
     Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
     2 Chase Foil Cards

Name: UNO Ultimate Marvel: Add-on Pack – Spider-man
Description:
With UNO Ultimate Marvel Add-On Spider-Man Pack, players can swap a new character into the core UNO Ultimate Card Game (sold separately, subject to availability). The Spider-Man Pack has an entire deck of UNO Ultimate cards, with graphics and special rules, designed specifically for this Super Hero to play as Spider-Man!

—description from the publisher

Spider-Man

        Spider-Man is always looking for danger. His power reflects his commitment to deal with Enemies. Use his Wild Cards to make players flip Danger Cards and move around Enemies. Sometimes you will want to take an Enemy from another player so that you can defeat it in order to set up your character power.


Included in this add-on pack:

     One Uno Ultimate Spider-Man Deck
     Character specific Wild Cards
     Danger Deck Cards with Villains and more!
     2 Chase Foil Cards

Name: The Few and Cursed: Encounter cards
Description:
Two new encounter cards for The few and cursed. 
In the desert you need water, in the ruins there is a murderer and in the ravine there are strange signs.
On the other card you will meet a hunter in the desert, in the ruins you can try your luck at gambling and in the canyon danger awaits.

Name: Dominion: Prosperity (Second Edition)
Description:
"Ah, money. There's nothing like the sound of coins clinking in your hands. You vastly prefer it to the sound of coins clinking in someone else's hands, or the sound of coins just sitting there in a pile that no-one can quite reach without getting up. Getting up, that's all behind you now. Life has been good to you. Just ten years ago, you were tilling your own fields in a simple straw hat. Today, your kingdom stretches from sea to sea, and your straw hat is the largest the world has ever known. You also have the world's smallest dog, and a life-sized statue of yourself made out of baklava. Sure, money can't buy happiness, but it can buy envy, anger, and also this kind of blank feeling. You still have problems - troublesome neighbours that must be conquered.
But this time, you'll conquer them in style."

—description from the back of the box

Part of the Dominion series.

Dominion: Prosperity (Second Edition) contains nine new types of Kingdom cards, which will be released on their own as an update pack for those who own the first edition of this expansion. A few cards will receive minor errata, but these will not appear in the update pack.

—description from the publisher

Name: SOS Save Our Species
Description:
The aim of the game is to have the most species points at the end of the game. Species that are living in habitat at the end of the game give you species points - the more endangered the species the higher the points (it ranges from 1 - 4 points per species card)

Players take turns playing. On your turn, you have 3 choices, and you can only pick one

     Pick up a card from either the biome deck draw pile or biome deck discard pile, and then put a card on the discard pile, so they remain with 7 cards.
     Create a biome by playing down at least 2 habitat cards, and at least one species card of the same biome type.
     Add to a biome, by placing at least 2 cards (species or habitat) of the same biome type next to one of your biomes.


When someone does option 2 or 3 they must pick up as many cards as they put down from the draw pile or discard pile. Then they must draw an event card and follow the instructions

Event cards can do things like:
Destroy habitat (species with no habitat become extinct and you lose their points)
Give you extra cards
Allow you to steal cards
Give you bonus national parks
And more...

The game ends when there are no cards left in the draw pile and discard pile. Everyone counts up their species points and whoever has the most wins.

—description from the designer

Name: Dino Fite
Description:
A 2-4 player card game where deception is your best friend.

Players take turn choosing one face up or face down Dino on their side of the field to attack a face up or face down Dino on their opponent's side of the field. If either player's Dino is face down, they may bluff the power of their Dino. However, this is a gamble.

If your opponent calls your bluff correctly, your Dino is revealed and destroyed and they are able to Bonk one of your Dinos. Bonking flips face up a face down Dino or destroys a face up Dino.

Once one player is no longer able to refill their field with a Dino, players reveal all surviving Dinos on the field, in their hand, and in their deck. Players sum the total of all their surviving Dinos and compare. The player with the higher total power has driven their opponent to extinction and has won!

Name: Attack & Defend
Description:
LUCK & SKILL: The perfect combination of both War and Uno card games. It is easy enough for kids to win, yet strategic enough for adults to stay entertained endlessly!

FAST & FUN: Play in 10 minutes. Players will try to build their deck as they take turns attacking others and defending themselves. Once the draw deck runs out, it becomes a race to be the first out of cards.

EASY TO LEARN: Beginners can learn by playing, reading the quick gameplay guides/directions, or watching a short Youtube instructional video with the creators as your guides.

TRAVEL-FRIENDLY: This small and study box can go anywhere! Take it on trips to the beach, camping, the office and anywhere else!

MAKES A GREAT GIFT: great for birthdays, holidays, events, and even party favors.

—description from the publisher

Name: Bad Landlord
Description:
Bad Landlord is a card game that combines wild landlording stories with dysfunctional responses.

Jillian in apartment 7 had her mail stolen, including a $100 gift card from Amazon. Turns out it was used by Stillman from across the hall. Do you suggest that they resolve it on a trashy courtroom reality show? Invite them to a group therapy session with the other tenants in the building? Or maybe just set them up on a blind date together? You’re the landlord, and the decision is yours!

Bad Landlord is a player judge game for 3-8 players. Each round a judge chooses the best response played to a given landlording situation. The first player to win 6 rounds wins the game.

Don’t we all wish we could be a bad landlord once in a while?

—description from the designer

Name: Like Cats and Dogs
Description:
In Like Cats & Dogs, each player runs their own pet shelter. The objective of the game is to get all the pets in your shelter ready to be adopted and paired with the perfect family. First player to empty their shelter wins!

Each Pet card has a list of Needs that you need to meet before they can be adopted. Meet these needs by traveling around the game board and collecting the corresponding cards. Once a Pet’s Needs have been met, search for their perfect Fur-ever Home at Adoption Events by comparing potential families to the Pets’ Home Requirements listed on the Pet card.

—description from the publisher

Name: Au pire, tu meurs !
Description:
This is a bluffing game as well as a party game.
The goal is to eliminate every other member of the Death family by reducing their life expectancy to 0 and become the last one standing.
At the beginning, each player draws secretly a Role card with a dedicated life expectancy as well as a starting hand of seven cards. There are two category of cards: attacks and other effects for managing other players' attacks.

Since everyone's life gauge is secret, the only way to eliminate a player is to call them out and say "You DIE!". They secretly show you their role card and the damage they received. If you were right, they are eliminated. If you were wrong, they retaliate by giving you one of the Attack card that stacked against them.

Name: Bad Baby Lich Lords
Description:
Bad Baby Lich Lords is a fast-paced competitive card game of necromancy and sibling rivalry for 2-4 players

Lich siblings battle it out in this competitive card game inspired by your favorite Saturday morning cartoons. Flip double-sided skeleton cards to raise the dead and activate their powers. Cast dark spells. Wrangle your unruly minions and set off chain reactions and combos. Collect sets of minion cards to meet the requirements to score on realms. Be the first player to make enough noise to wake up the sleeping Lich King!

Featuring over 100+ double-sided cards with full art by award winning artist Taylor Dow.

Choose from 4 factions with unique abilities.

Name: Cangaço: Compadecida promo card
Description:
Promo card for CangaÃ§o.

The power of the Compadecida card is completely linked to the movie O Alto da Compadecida, and makes the round in which it is played a little more dynamic, allowing the whole table to recover a discarded card and play it performing its effect normally.

Name: TRAILS: Watchtower Badge Promo Cards
Description:
Originally available during the Dice Tower 2022 Season Kickstater campaign, Promo Set A ("Air").

A set of 3 additional badges (1 each in rock, acorn, and leaf badge type), for use with TRAILS base game. The "Watchtower" badge has a steep cost of 6 identical resources of that badge's type, with the worthwhile upside of 5 victory points, and 3 of that same resource back to you.

Name: Haphazards
Description:
Haphazards is a hilarious card game for 3-8 players. Each round, one player encounters a dangerous hazard. The other players use their cards to attempt a rescue. The player with the best rescue wins.

Can you defeat the Yeti with a banana, a circus tent, and a hampster? Can you cross a ravine with a bale of hay, a skateboard, and a jackalope? With 270 cards in the deck, the possibilities are endless!

—description from the publisher

Name: The Game of Telegraph Messenger Boy
Description:
The card game adaptation of the 1886 McLoughlin Brothers board game District Messenger Boy.

Each player is dealt cards forming a face down pile. In turn order, players turn over the top card of the pile.  The initial objective is to obtain employment as the Messenger Boy. Over the course of the game players try to advance to more senior positions in the Company, until one player becomes its President.

From the McLoughlin Brothers 1914 Catalogue - “The Messenger Boy game has been a favorite for a generation, and there is no evident reason why a card game on the same lines should not be equally popular.”

Name: Shelter
Description: In Shelter, you will take the role of running a cat shelter. Send your volunteers out to the neighborhood to rescue community cats in need. Along the way, you can purchase resources to fulfill each rescued cat's needs. Seek help from fosterers or cat cafes if you are overwhelmed. Rehabilitate your rescues and, ultimately, send them to their forever homes or release them through the trap–neuter–release program.

Name: 时间互搏：学园偶像计划（Chrono Clash System: LoveLive!）
Description:
From the mind of renowned American game designer, Ryan Miller, comes Chrono Clash System.
The cost of the card moves the marker towards the opponent's side, and when it goes over 1, then it's your opponent's turn!
Play many low cost cards or play a high cost card from the get-go. Play your favorite cards whenever you want in this dynamic but easy to play game!
Utilizing the universal Chrono Clash system, the universes and characters used will draw in players of card games, board games and each respective universe's fans alike!
The Chinese version Chrono Clash system game comes two famous IPs, Kamen Rider and LoveLive project.

Name: Lock 'n Load Tactical: Valor of the 13th
Description:
Into the Endless Plains of Russia

Valor of the 13th Expansion is an expansion for Heroes of the Motherland from the Lock ‘n Load Tactical system.  It features fluid, impulse-based turns, squad-level actions, and individual heroics.  The scenarios inside represent the efforts of the Soviet 13th Army to defend the area around Ponyari during the vital crucial days of July 6th through July 12th of 1943, during the German Operation Citadel-the fight to eliminate the Kursk salient. The scenarios focus on the battles around Hill 253.5 and the plains to the east of the hill. Massive infantry and armor engagements rage and flow around these battlefields, as both sides scramble to gain an advantage.  Also included are a new set of Vehicle rules that expand on the existing Vehicle rules presented in the Lock ‘n Load Tactical System Core Rules and were designed for this expansion pack. They now allow you to damage and destroy the mobility and combat capabilities of vehicles.  Included are ten brand-new scenarios, two giant maps (one 34" x 22", and one 22" x 17"), and a counter sheet with over 100 counters. 

The Defenses of Kursk beckons you back to  Heroes of the Motherland!

—description from the publisher

Name: Castle Made of Sand (砂上のROW閣)
Area 52
Description:
As the commander of the Frontline Alien Resistance Team, you must manage a squad of elite soldiers to fight off a wave of invading aliens. After the first wave, the aliens will attack again with deadlier force - you win if you are able to repel both waves without running out of resources. Having a good variety and spread of defenders is critical to efficiently counter the invaders.

The game is heavily reliant on luck. Despite this, there’s still an undercurrent of subtle strategy, related to concepts of probability and mathematical parity.

Area 52 is a solo tower-defense game played with a deck of regular playing cards, inspired by games such as Button Men and Onslaught. The rules were created by Wil Su and made available free online as part of his "Isaludo" series.

Name: Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible
Description:
Objetivos de Desarrollo Sostenible is an educational game developed for the UN delegation in Villa María, Argentina. It is a very simple cooperative game in real time and designed for people of any age. The game also has a debate stage where it seeks to raise awareness about the Sustainable Development Goals and think about what we can do from our place to make the world a better place. The game is not for profit.

Cooperative game, where the participants will collect idea sheets and assign them to the different ODS cards to meet their objectives and obtain the best possible score... They only have 5 minutes!

Name: Devil Dots
Description: The game consists of 36 dice (six dice in each of six colors). Each player draws three random dice from a bag to start the game. Players take turns choosing to roll 1, 2, or all 3 of their dice and then adding those to a growing grid of dice so that all the colors and numbers of dice in each row and column are either all the same or all different. Players score one point for each die in every row and column to which dice were added on their turn. Players replenish back to three dice at the end of their turns. Play ends when the bag is empty.

Name: Sword & Sorcery: Northwind Tales – Challenge Set
Description: The Northwind Tales Challenge Set is a collection of all the "rank and file" enemies (green and blue) included in Northwind Tales in a variant rank, allowing players to modify the game difficulty and the overall game experience by combining the original enemies with these new enemies.

Name: Spearmint Island
Description:
Spearmint Island is being invaded, and it’s up to the lesser spirits and natives of the island to fend off the attacks and save themselves from being wiped from existence! As the player, you take on the role of a spirit that inhabits the island and use a mix of powers at the right time to stop the invaders from spreading out and ravaging the land. The invaders are strong, but your spirit will grow in power as the game progresses. Will you be able to send the invaders fleeing from your homeland, or will the island succumb to their ever-increasing population and blighting of the land?

—description from the designer

Name: Let's Make A Deal
Description: Pressman's home edition of the 2009-current CBS version of the TV game show, hosted by Wayne Brady. Gameplay is similar to the Let's Make A Deal from Ideal, but with updated prizes & Zonks plus it now has separate plastic door & box stands rather than a "full stage" setup.
Families: TV Shows: Let's Make a Deal

Name: Arm's Length
Description:
Cards
52, ranking AKQJ1098765432 in each suit.

Deal
Deal each player 13 cards, one at a time and face down.

Object
In each round one member of each partnership aims to win as many tricks as possible and the other as few as possible. The difference between the numbers of tricks they win is their 'arm's length'.

Play
After examining their cards two partners agree which of them will take the high road and which the low. The player at dealer's left leads to the first trick. There is no trump suit until someone can't follow suit to the card led. Whatever they then discard to that trick establishes trumps for the rest of the round.

Any card may be led to a trick, but the rules of following are 'forcing'. This means that you must seek to win the trick if you can (even if, as the low player, you don’t want to).

The trick is taken by the highest card of the suit led or by the highest trump if any are played, and the winner of each trick leads to the next.

Score
At end of play each partnership scores 10 times their arm's length plus the number taken by the high player.

Name: Basileus II
Description:
Basileus II is the sixth module of the game system "À la Charge !". It uses the special characteristics of Basileus: Byzance Xe-XIe S., such as Unseizable, and the particularly formidable units, the Byzantine cataphracts.

With a standard hex & counter "I go - You go" system, players play  certain number of turns, in each of which there are movement & combat phases for both players, until the victory conditions are met (usually reaching a morale threshold for eliminated units). The game includes typical wargame concepts like Zone of Control, command, ranged fire or close combat (melee), checking morale and retreating.

There are five proposed battles:

     Andrassos 960
     Orontes 994
     Azaz 1030
     Manzikert 1071
     Zombos Bridge 1074
Families: Players: Wargames with Rules Supporting Only Two Players

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Stark Heroes 3
Description: House Stark is the last major House in Westeros’ northern reaches. The strong people of Winterfell are always prepared, the core of which is a tight-knit family, surrounded by many faithful bannermen. The House has marched to war, led by Robb, the King in the North, as he seeks revenge on those for what has happened to his father, Ned, Hand of the King, in King’s Landing. He is joined by many, such as Maege and Lyanna Mormont, Brynden “Blackfish” Tully, and Rickard Karstark, all pledging themselves to the Stark’s cause. These hardy individuals will show that House Stark’s toughness against the cold shall spread to all corners of Westeros.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannisport City Watch
Description:
The Lannisport Enforcers Unit Box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives House Lannister a new, stalwart unit for their formations. Armed with deadly spears and suited in sturdy armor, they may not be the best choice for a vanguard but having them hold a flank is well within their means as they adapt to both offensive and defensive needs. Plus, their resolve keeps them in a fight, especially when outnumbering the enemy.

Contents:
12 Miniatures
  â€£ 1 Bannerman
  â€£11 Lannisport City Watch
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Lannister Heroes 3
Description: With Joffrey Baratheon’s ascension to the Iron Throne, House Lannister controls King’s Landing from behind the throne. With ambition as deep as their coffers, House Lannister seeks to legitimize their claim on the throne. Queen Cersei & Tommen exert their influence in the halls of power while out in the field, her brother Jaime, despite being taken hostage, still works towards the Lannister’s favor. Sir Kevan Lannister works to see his niece’s ambitions met. Meanwhile, the House’s allies such as The Mountain that Rides, Ser Addam Marbrand, Qyburn, and Ser Robert Strong work to maintain House Lannister’s grip on the Iron Throne. It will not be broken easily.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Drowned Men
Description: Armored with only their faith, and armed only with deadwood cudgels and other detritus from a storm-wracked shore; the Drowned Men make surprisingly effective support for followers of the Kraken banner. Their presence in battle signifies the Drowned God’s blessing, bolstering men to fight past their wounds and strike all the harder against their foes. While few in number, the drowned Men’s faith is such that they can survive even killing blows. That said, strong as their faith may be, a wise commander should not be putting these fanatics in the vanguard. Working with flankers or in direct support of the line ensures the Drowned God’s blessings are shared equally among his people.
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: A Song of Ice & Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game – Free Folk Frozen Shore Bear Riders
Description:
The Frozen Shore Bear Riders unit box for the A Song of Ice and Fire: Tabletop Miniatures Game gives Free Folk commanders one of the hardiest cavalry units ever fielded in battle. While being kicked by a destrier might be a worry, it doesn’t hold a candle to being mauled by a bear while its rider stabs at you with their spear. Enemies are sure to be in disarray when this monstrous cavalry unit makes it into battle.

Contents:
4 Miniatures
  â€£ 4 Frozen Shore Bear Riders
1 Unit Card
1 Movement Tray
Families: Books: A Song of Ice and Fire
Game: A Song of Ice & Fire – Tabletop Miniatures Game

Name: Space Fruit Tree
Description:
1 - 2 player space-themed tile game in which you grow a space fruit tree to earn points

Grow the largest tree, take some fruit and win!

In this 1 or 2 player space themed tile game you will grow a space fruit tree to earn points.

During the 1 player game you'll Grow 2 Space Fruit Trees on your own while keeping each tree balanced so you can score as many points as possible.

During the 2 player game you'll be able to steal branches and fruit from your opponent's tree to earn even more points. The first player to earn 15 points wins!

Name: Commandeer
Description: A strategic, flicking game where you combo into the other players ships to commandeer them as your own.  To win you must kill all of your oppononent's ships or kill his king.  Just be sure not to commit treason or you lose the game!

Name: Nova Burn: Tabletop Shmup Action
Description:
Tabletop. Shmup. Action.

Choose your ship, load the wave, and blast 'em all in this tactical, grid-based RPG! Each wave is made of a set of enemy ships who fire a bullet pattern at you. It is then your turn to dodge and return fire!

Nova Burn uses simple, easy to learn d6 rules to emulate classic shoot 'em up video games through tactical combat. It is for one player and you can play by writing in the book!

—description from the publisher

Name: Boocoo Fire Mission
Description:
Boocoo Fire Mission is the result of 3 years of research and playtesting, drawing from first-hand accounts of the war to create a wargame seasoned with plenty of historical flavor. A simple and effective hidden movement system allows players to really sweat as they try to work out if it's safe to cross that open field in front of them. Plans don't usually survive contact with the enemy, and a number of mishap tables help to create a narrative experience that goes beyond your average "move and shoot" wargame.

Boocoo Fire Mission is aimed at 6mm or 15mm miniatures, and can be played on a 4' x 4' or 6' x 4' table.

This game is company scaled, and the smallest maneuver unit is the squad, with players generally controlling 2 - 4 platoons, each with a number of squads and an HQ. Players will direct their forces on the ground, as well as coordinating support such as air strikes, artillery, and taking advantage of special assets such as VC spider holes or booby traps, or the NVA's stubborn resistance and uncanny ability to recover casualties, preventing US a body count...

Rules are provided for infantry, from the lowest quality ARVN troops, to the most elite ANZAC SAS and US Recon squads, and their various weapon attachments such as RPGs, LMGs, Recoilless rifles, and mortars, as well as helicopters such as the UH-1, AH-1 Cobra, OH-6 Loach and CH-47 Chinook. Vehicles such as the M113, M48 Patton, M551 Sheridan, various marine "amtracs", the M42 Duster, and M50 Ontos are also covered.

Boocoo Fire Mission is has a descending level of detail, with infantry as the most detailed unit in the game, followed by helicopters, and finally vehicles. Infantry can hide, dig in, crawl to avoid opportunity fire, and conduct suppression. Helicopters have detailed damage tables to provide for many interesting results from fire, and can drop off and pick up infantry on the table. Vehicles can disembark their crew, leaving sentries behind to man a single weapon, and can also transport infantry.

Army lists are provided for ANZACs, ARVN, US army, Armored Cavalry, Mechanized companies, and US marines. VC and NVA are of course included, and some factions are split into different time periods depending on if their equipment evolved over the course of the war. Boocoo Fire Mission covers the entire Vietnam War, from early ARVN vs VC skirmishes in the early 1960s, through to 1975. Specific city fight lists are also included for both the Allied and Communist forces, to allow players to play battles such as those in Hue or Saigon.

The game provides printable markers, and a printer-friendly version of the rules is also provided. Note that the markers are only in the full-color version of the rules.

—description from the publisher

Name: Necromunda: Underhive – Cawdor Gang Tactic Cards
Description:
This box contains 26 100mm x 75mm cards for use in games of Necromunda:

18x Cawdor gang-specific Tactics cards
8x Blank Fighter cards

You will need a copy of the Necromunda: Rulebook and Necromunda: House of Faith to use the contents of this set.

Name: Block and Key: Adventurers Pack
Description:
Four cards with special adventurers:
- Keysmith allows you to place any 1 key at the bottom of either altar and then draw top card
- Sculptor allows you to discard at the end of your turn any number of blocks and to draw new ones
- Architect allows you, once per turn, after placing one block, to discard 1 block to place another
- Curators allows you, after placing a block, to draw one from any excavation sites closest to you

Name: Farm Fuss
Description:
The game takes place on a farm, where all the animals fight for their position in line to be the farmer's favourite. Players take turns playing the animal cards, which activate the animal's abilities and changes their position in line. The animal that is the closest to the farmer at the end of the game is the winner.
The goal of the game is to play the cards of the winning animal in order to gain as many victory points as possible.

Name: Tiere der Welt: Wissensreise durch die Wildnis
Description:
In this exciting puzzle game, children learn about the animals of the world. The players guess which animals are hidden behind the puzzle cards. In the process, they discover more and more animal characteristics and abilities. Players discover the different characteristics and abilities of the animals to figure out which animals are being searched for on the puzzle cards.

The puzzle cards in the game each depict four animals and four traits, with all traits always applying to only one of the animals depicted. At the beginning of the round, the traits are covered with a marker. A player can make a trait available to all or - once per game - to himself alone. Afterwards, players can make a guess as to which animal the already visible properties apply to. Once a player has guessed, the player is out for the round. After the fourth hint at the latest, everyone must have guessed. All players who have guessed correctly receive points according to the difficulty of the puzzle card and advance accordingly many spaces on a track. When a player has gone around the track once, the game ends and that player wins.

Name: Flotsam Float
Description:
Skill is required in this game of island hopping. Flotsam Float contains 24 colorful stacking stones. This flotsam and jetsam must be collected and stacked on the wobbly raft. You need a steady hand because the fully loaded raft must be balanced to the next island.

In clockwise order, players pick a wooden piece and must stack it on one of the raft cards on top of the already existing found objects. In doing so, they must not move the other pieces. If no piece fell, that player may take an island card that has shells and a symbol on it. The symbol indicates which island the raft must be balanced to in the second phase. The islands are each four cards with a symbol on them, which are randomly distributed in the game area during the set-up. The raft card must be moved, but the found objects may not be touched. If again nothing has fallen down, this player gets the number of shells credited as points. The game is over as soon as only one island has island cards left. The player with the most shells wins.

Name: Pundit
Description:
Pundit is football’s original trivia game, made for fans like ourselves, who love to revisit memories of legendary players and iconic moments!

Challenge friends and family to see who best remembers the forgotten greats, cult heroes, one-hit wonders, fringe players and young prospects - to take the Pundit crown!

1. Choose your best five categories to compete in.
Taking turns, the two teams pick a question category to compete in. Whichever team wins the coin toss picks three categories, the loser picks two.

2. Answer questions correctly to keep hold of the ball.
When answering a question correctly the attacking team chooses to either pass the ball up the pitch or draw a Tactic card. If answered wrong, possession is turned over to the opponent’s captain.

3. Forwards score the goals.
When the attacking team gets a question right with the ball at their forward’s feet, a goal is scored. It’s also possible to score from the penalty spot via Tactic cards.

4. A match lasts 45 minutes.
When time is up, the team in possession can finish their attack for one last attack on goal. No Tactic cards allowed in stoppage time, it’s in God’s hands from here.

Name: Sly'ne
Description:
In this puzzle game, players must align their four marbles in a straight to win.

Each turn, the participants must perform two actions among the following five:


    Place a tile
    Move a tile
    Place a marble
    Move a marble
    Place a barricade


The game ends as soon as a player manages to align their four marbles in a straight uninterrupted line (without a barricade blocking the path).

The board is not fixed, the hexagons can be moved just like the marbles.
But be careful, the tides can quickly change and a simple mistake can lead you in a world of pain.

Name: Flavius Rule
Description:
Plucked from daily life by our sponsor Flavius and forced into vicious arena events, players are tasked 
with surviving in a deadly gladiator arena at the twisted delight of Flavius and for the much needed favor 
of the crowds. With your body, freedom, and friendships at stake, will tensions push you to defy the sponsor 
and serve for personal glory, or will you accept and satisfy Flavius' rule?

Flavius Rule is a turn-based gladiatorial strategy game for 4x players
(with extra events supporting 1-8x players)

Starting with a humble class loadout, each player tries to advance their gladiator in several ways;
battling savage arena animals and spawned opponents, acquiring shiny new armor and weapons, 
precious coin, strategic tokens, gracious crowd favor, or drawing helpful, albeit risky arena cards. 
The Summa Rudis, NPCs, pesky spectators and more will hinder your chance for success, however 
the most difficult challenge will be eliminating one another to be the last remaining player.

—description from the designer

Name: Schollen treiben
Description:
The animals in the Arctic are bored. That's why polar bears, seals, ice gulls and even the odd orca have arranged to play a fun little game: floating on the ice floes.

So without further ado, the animals jump around happily on the ice floes and try to form the largest possible groups with conspecifics. The orcas help where they can and the other animals pass the time cheerfully in the icy Arctic Ocean.

In this fun card game by author Martin Schlegel, 2-6 people aged 8 and up must have good eyes.

In each round, the aim is to find the best possible place for the newly revealed card in order to form the largest possible groups of animals of the same species.

How is the game played?
At the beginning, 2 cards are placed in the middle, whereby it does not matter whether their islands fit together sensibly or not. The remaining cards form the draw pile.

Then turn over another card, place it in plain sight for everyone to see, and start a 1-minute countdown.

Now the "let the heads smoke" phase begins:

Which of you will find the best place for the new card? You should make sure that as many animals of the same species (polar bears, seals, ice gulls) as possible come together on the newly created floes.

If an orca can be seen on both maps, the points are doubled.

Within the 1-minute countdown, everyone now looks for the best place for the new map and you all note down the highest possible score.

At the end of the minute, you compare the numbers and whoever has the highest number of points has to prove that putting on the card also brings in the corresponding number of points.

If this is successful, the person receives 3 extra points in addition to the number of points he or she has written down; all others receive the number of points they have written down.

If this is not successful, the person goes away empty-handed; all the others receive their points and the card is discarded.

In the game instructions you will find 2 more variants: One where you outscore each other by calling out the scores, another with an hourglass. The scoring remains the same in both cases.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Name: Mixture Mischief
Description:
In this cooperative game a group of young alchemists try to prepare potions before the ingredients run out. Players add ingredients - play different coloured cards into the cauldron. However, mischievous cats will cause a lot of trouble and can ruin the recipe.
The goal of the game is to prepare as many potions as possible, working together, adding ingredients, and repairing the mischief caused by the cats. The players have won if they prepare enough potions before the ingredients run out. The more they prepare, the better the final score.

Name: Maszat és az elveszett plüssök
Description:
Maszat took a trip to the near forest and only at home he realised that his toys must have escaped while resting and snacking. They are lost. Help them find the way home before sunset or Tigriske the housecat will occupy their basket and they won’t have a place to rest.

This is a cooperative memory game in which you have to find the right tiles in the correct order to guide home the toys before Tigriske completes his track. In your turn you declare which tile you are looking for and if you flip the right one you move the toy closer. If the flipped tile is not the one you were looking for everyone tries to memorise it so you will remember where it is when it’s needed later. With each error Tigriske moves. You win if you guide home all the toys. If Tigriske gets back before the last toy he curls up in the basket leaving no space for the toys and you loose the game.

Based ont he Maszat book series by Judit Berg.

Name: Ironclads of the American Civil War
Description:
On March 9, 1862, the clash of the ironclad gunboats CSS Virginia and USS Monitor at the Battle of Hampton Roads heralded a new age of naval warfare. The innovations of the early industrial era yielded powerful new warships, armed with strong new guns, and plated with thick metal armor. A new ironclad navy threatened to revolutionize the practice of naval warfare, rendering old wooden fleets obsolete.
 This solitaire book game explores the use of ironclads during the American Civil War through a series of scenarios that teach the system gradually. In seeking to capture essential qualities of the battles in a fast and playable system, many aspects of these conflicts have been abstracted. Simplicity and ease of play have taken precedence over intricate rules and historical detail.

Each scenario consists of a playsheet (left) and mapsheet (right), and features a short historical introduction. The scenarios, which each usually take 20 to 30 minutes to play, walk you through the rules. As you progress from scenario to scenario, new rules will be added, basic rules will be upgraded to ‘standard’ or ‘advanced’ status, and scenario-specific rules may come into play. By the end of the book, you’ll have experienced the game system in full, and perhaps something of ironclad history as well.

—description from the designer
